sections.heading: xgrammar-rs
sections.text:
This project provides safe and idiomatic Rust bindings for the
xgrammar
C++ library.
By wrapping the C++ implementation, this crate leverages Rust's memory safety
andguarantees while providing access to
xgrammar
's high-performance and features
for constraint decoding.

children.heading: Prerequisites
children.text:
Before building the project, ensure you have the following dependencies installed:
Rust toolchain
: Install via
rustup
.
CMake
: Required to build the underlying C++
xgrammar
library.
C++ compiler
: A modern C++ compiler that supports C++17 (Clang is hightly recommended.)

children.heading: Build
children.text:
The C++
xgrammar
library is included as a submodule and will be compiled automatically as part of the build process.
To build the project, run the following command:
cargo build --release
This will create a release build in the
target/release
directory.

children.heading: Test
children.text:
This project uses
cargo-nextest
for running tests. To execute all tests, run:
make
test
You can also pass arguments to
cargo nextest
via the
TEST_ARGS
variable. For example, to run a specific test suite:
make
test
TEST_ARGS=
"
--test test_grammar
"
